reviews.review_msg:
Kirsten is a great professor. Definitely reading heavy course but if you're attending lectures, you're totally fine.

She is accessible outside class and so understanding. Her grading is fair and she provides amazing feedback that actually showcases how to do better and she gives further opportunities to work for better grades.

Dr McAllister is one of the sweetest professors I've come across in my 4 years. She's so caring and genuine and makes sure the students are engaging in class and not left out. The readings are heavy but actively listening to her lectures and examples help alot. Kirsten also engages in a lot of group interaction among students that makes things easy
Just a bad and temperamental professor who is highly opinionated and rude

Nawal makes an impact! She definitely reads these!! Hi Nawal, thanks for the great semester, I just hope I do what I've learned justice through my final project and going forward in life!! CMNS 452, Race and the Media causes you to confront yourself and life as you know it, get ready but also welcome the changes with open arms

Honestly, I have never had a harder time in any of my classes and Nawal seems to make sure her students know her political ideas/agendas take precedence. In terms of grades, it would be easier to wrestle meat out an alligator's mouth than getting good grades from Nawal. Extremely displeased from my semester with her; she is an academic iceberg.

Nawal is a very caring professor. She wants you to do well, but on her own terms. Her lectures are long and very repetitive. She basically reads the assigned readings back to you and asks broad questions while expecting specific answers. Even if your answer is correct she won't accept it until someone reads her mind.

Nawal is an incredible professor, educated and knowledgable about Race & Media. This class opened my eyes to so many new things and lectures are extremely interesting. Class participation is crucial to do well. Graded on participation, group assignment, and creative project. Highly recommend this class for anyone in any major, it will change you!

I was hesitant to take this class but am glad I did. Nawal's lectures are super interesting. She clearly knows her stuff is very supportive of her students. She gives marks if they are deserved even if that means the whole class gets A's (but make sure you do the readings every week). I would highly recommend this class if you can get into it!

My favourite instructor in 5 years at SFU. Genuinely interested in (and knowledgeable about) the class material, gives engaging, relevant lectures and isn't afraid to be an actual human being. Do whatever it takes to get into one of his classes, for sure.

First review I felt compelled to do at SFU - Marcos is simply amazing. Engaging lectures, very knowledgeable person, and life changing course. Marcos expects you to try, and as long as you do then you will do well. You will learn about the effects that white supremacy has on indigenous, Black, and Muslim people and understand recurring patterns.

I think he's one of the most attentive profs out there. He seems strict at first, but you realize it is very reasonable and doable. He gives good feedback and is fair with his marking. Lectures are interesting and helpful. There's relatively few readings, but you have to read them all for the blogs. Be attentive too, or he might call out on you.

Super awesome instructor with obvious passion for what he teaches. There is a fair amount of work, but his expectations are reasonable considering that it's a 400-lvl cmns course. His manner of speech can seem blunt, but he's an extremely understanding/nurturing instructor if you seek help on reasonable grounds.

LOVED this class and this prof! Marcos applied a lot of examples that we see in everyday life and he was always accessible for help (online & in person). Mini blogs are a bit time consuming but they help boost your mark. Great approach to teaching very controversial issues. Highly recommended if you like to voice your opinions in class.
